1.text: “Brothers and fathers, listen to the defense which I now make to you.”

2.text: When the people heard that he was addressing them in the Hebrew language, they were even more quiet. Paul continued,

3.text: “I am indeed a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel. I was instructed according to the strict tradition of the law of our fathers, being zealous for God, even as you all are this day.

4.text: I persecuted this Way to death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women, as

5.text: the high priest and the entire council of the presbyters can testify. I even received letters for their brethren in Damascus and traveled there to bring these people in chains to Jerusalem to be punished.

6.text: It happened that, suddenly, as I was on my journey and approaching Damascus, at about noon, a great light shone from the sky around me.

7.text: I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?’

8.text: I answered, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ He said to me, ‘I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you persecute.’

9.text: Indeed, those who were with me saw the light and were afraid, but they did not understand the voice of him who spoke to me.

10.text: I asked, ‘What shall I do, Lord?’ The Lord said to me, ‘Arise, and go into Damascus. There, you will be told what you should do.’

11.text: Since I could not see because of the glory of that light, I was led by the hand of those who were with me and arrived in Damascus.

12.text: Someone named Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well spoken of by all the Jews, and who lived in Damascus, came to me.

13.text: Standing by me, he said, ‘Brother Saul, receive your sight!’ At that very moment, I was able to see him!

14.text: He said, ‘The God of our fathers has appointed you to know his will, and to see the Righteous One, and to hear a voice from his mouth.

15.text: For you will be a witness for him to all people, testifying to what you have seen and heard.

16.text: Now why do you wait? Arise, be baptized, and wash away your sins, calling on the Name of the Lord.’

17.text: It happened that, when I had returned to Jerusalem, and while I was praying in the temple, I fell into a trance.

18.text: I saw the Lord saying to me, ‘Hurry and get out of Jerusalem quickly, because they will not receive your testimony concerning me.’

19.text: I said, ‘Lord, they themselves know that in every synagogue I imprisoned and beat those who believed in you.

20.text: When the blood of your martyr Stephen was shed, I too was standing by, consenting to his death and guarding the coats of those who killed him.’

21.text: Then he said to me, ‘Depart, for I will send you out far from here to the Gentiles.’”

22.text: They listened to him until he said that; then they lifted up their voice, and shouted, “Rid the earth of this fellow, for he is not fit to live!”

23.text: As they were shouting and throwing off their cloaks and dust into the air,

24.text: the commanding officer ordered that Paul be brought into the barracks. He [then] gave instruction that Paul should be interrogated under scourging, so that he might find out for what crime the people shouted against him in such a way.

25.text: When they had tied him up with straps, Paul asked the centurion who stood by, “Is it lawful for you to flog a man who is a Roman [citizen] and uncondemned?”

26.text: When the centurion heard this, he went to the commanding officer and told him, “Take care what you do, for this man is a Roman [citizen]!”

27.text: Then the commanding officer came and asked Paul, “Tell me, are you a Roman?” Paul replied, “Yes.”

28.text: The commanding officer answered, “I bought my citizenship for a great price!”  “But I was born a Roman,” Paul replied.

29.text: Immediately those who were about to interrogate him left him, and even the commanding officer was afraid when he realized that he had bound Paul, a Roman [citizen], in chains.

30.text: But on the next day, desiring to know the truth about why Paul was accused by the Jews, the officer freed him from the bonds and commanded the chief priests and all their Sanhedrin to appear. He then brought Paul down and set him before them.
